# Copilot Instructions for Lubdhok Batch Website

<!-- Use this file to provide workspace-specific custom instructions to Copilot. For more details, visit https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/copilot-customization#_use-a-githubcopilotinstructionsmd-file -->

## Project Overview
This is a Next.js website for the Lubdhok batch to share study materials, lectures, slides, notes, and assignments organized by semester. This is a frontend-only portfolio-style website with hardcoded content.

## Key Guidelines
- Use TypeScript for all components and pages
- Follow Next.js App Router conventions
- Use Tailwind CSS for styling with a modern, clean design
- Create responsive layouts that work on mobile and desktop
- Organize content by semesters
- Use semantic HTML elements for better accessibility
- Include proper metadata for SEO
- Keep the design simple and focused on content accessibility

## Project Structure
- All content should be hardcoded in the frontend
- No backend integration required
- Use static data for semester information and resources
- Components should be reusable and well-documented
- Follow naming conventions: PascalCase for components, camelCase for functions
